On Wed, 25 Aug 2004 22:00:22 +0100, Colin Green <cgreen@...> wrote:
> Thanks for the update. I think it would be interesting (and revealing)
> to be able to see how the roving eye moves around the image during a
> recognition. Apart from being cool to look at (would make a nice
> demonstration) it might give some indication of the strategy the eye is
> using to distinguish between characters.

Yup...we've got a utility that displays the eye location in one frame
and what it's seeing each time step in the second.  It's been a pretty
useful diagnostic tool, and we'll probably use something like it if we
ever do a presentation on this stuff.

> The long search durations are a bit of a concern going forward, but not
> unexpected given the complexity of the tasks. What sort of hardware was
> the search running on BTW?

A standard desktop PC (2.6 GHz/768 MB).  Jim has worked on a
distributed framework for his runs, and that's definitely something
we'd like to integrate into ANJI at some point.  There are probably
still a number of optimizations to the code we could make as well.

Derek
